page.title: 12Birds of the South Downs
page.content: Eric Tyler,Michelle Light and Stephen Ball all went onto the Downs near Lewes Old Race Course to go bird watching with Mrs Gibbons.When we got there the first birds we saw were Swallows.We saw many Swallows,Sky Larks,Swifts and Sparrows.We only saw one Collared dove and a few House Martins. We also saw a Magpie,two Crows,a Blackbird and two Yellow Wagtails. There was one bird that made us all jump.It was a partridge.It flew out of the long grass right in front of us, but we only saw one of them.The bird that wes really special for us was a Yellow Hammer.It had a yellow brownish brest.We had not seen one before and we only saw one all the time we were looking. We observed the birds for one hour using a book to identify them.
